definitions.definition: A derivative of the pentose sugar ribose in which the 2' hydroxyl (- OH ) is reduced to a hydrogen ( H ); it is a constituent of the nucleotides that constitute the biopolymer , deoxyribonucleic acid , or DNA .

main_definition: ( biochemistry ) A derivative of the pentose sugar ribose in which the 2' hydroxyl (- OH ) is reduced to a hydrogen ( H ); it is a constituent of the nucleotides that constitute the biopolymer , deoxyribonucleic acid , or DNA .
